page.title: 14Wiggen's Farm,House,Barn.
page.content: The barn was built about 1470 so it is 515 years old.A man named{Cecil Hewitt could tell how old the barn was by a {scarf joint}which is two pieces of wood joined together with a peg in the middle of the two pieces of wood.The lord of the land had in the barn two wooden floors and one firm floor and men used to thresh using a flail on the two wooden floors.The lord made them get to a rythm.When the lord was a mile away he could still hear them flailing on the wooden floors.Then in Victorian times the{Emson}family took over and they bred big heavy horses called{Percherons.}The house has a kitchen and breakfast room which are as old as the barn.They are 515 years old.They were a dairy. They used to keep cows in with them.The floor was built in Tudor times. For a time the barn was a Health Food Store.
